messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:28): f9e12e0466f4d059b78bb3f863633092: it's exploratory for now, being discussed on <email/>
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:38): hello there
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:38): in regards to html5 coming from xhtml
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:39): i read in xhtml they put a trailing slash becuase of compatibility issues with some browsers
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:39): and i read that in html5 you dont need it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:39): like in <br> or <img>?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:39): but it wouldnt be an issue if br hr meta still use it?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:39): yeah <br /> <hr /> yeah <img />
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:39): html5 lets you do it either like html4 or like xhtml, so you can do <br> or <br/>, doesn't matter
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:40): (the / is ignored)
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:40): cause i just converted www.truecarnage.org
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:40): it wasnt that much of a change but i kinda want to cater to both
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:40): is that possible?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:40): both what?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:40): to do html5 and yet keep to standards im used to in xhtml?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:41): yes, you can do that, HTML5 allows you to include the /
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:41): in HTML5 you can do <br/> and it is valid
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:41): how much of html5 is usable now?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:41): browser compatibility?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:42): pretty much all the stuff that was already in html4, as well as many other parts
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:42): there are guides on the web that discuss that in more detail
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:42): you guys deprecating <dv>?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:42): <div>
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:43): <section> <aside> i read some stuff on that I will definitely read more on it
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:43): do you guys have icons for passing validation?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): <div> isn't deprecated, it should be used when you need something to hook some styles on
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:44): why did xhtml force transitional for <iframe> and target="_blank"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): no icons for passing validation, but we do have a validator at html5.validator.nu
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): dunno, that was another working group
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): html5 doesn't have a transitional anymore
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): and it allows <iframe> and target=""
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:44): nice cause i like to use _blank and it would fail me on strict
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:45): i read w3c has accepted html5
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:45): and its still ok to specify the types of script and styles?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:46): <script type="text/javascript">?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:46): you can, don't need to though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:46): <script> is fine
f9e12e0466f4d059b78bb3f863633092 (04:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e - will being a member of the HTMLwg help me get into the device api wg?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:47): f9e12e0466f4d059b78bb3f863633092: as far as i know it's just a mailing list, unless you want to call into the meetings (but i don't bother with that)
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:47): html5 is separate so there won't be a worry about bias towards browsers?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): that would be the browser issue?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:48): how do you mean?
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): thats one huge reason i used xhtml
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): is that it tried to be ocmpatible
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): across browsers and devices
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): i wouldnt want to work with a language that favors IE or Safari or chrome
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:48): over another
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:48): html5 is significantly more compatible with browsers and devices than either XHTML or HTML4 ever were
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:49): cool so it wont be driven by browser its its own
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:50): one thing i notice in internet explorer 8, many sites have javascript errors
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:50): big sites
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:51): espn, even id's quakelive, fancast
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): that might have more to do with IE8 having bugs rather than the sites
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:51): i was wondering
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): IE8 doesn't do javascript (or rather, the DOM) in a very standards-compliant way
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): see e.g. how it does on acid3, which mostly tests DOM/JS stuff
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:52): how far are we from css3?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (04:52): Is it correct to say there is no subset of valid HTML5 documents that would also validate as HTML 4.01 or XHTML 1.0?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:52): no
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:52): www.truecarnage.org does
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:52): ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee: there are two HTML4 and XHTML1 DOCTYPEs that will validate as HTML5 (with a warning)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (04:53): ah okay
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:53): a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0: css3 is a large number of specs, and i don't know how they are progressing, i'm out of touch with the css stuff these days
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:54): thats cool apreciate your prompt replies to the questions :)
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:54): i just worry about compatibility and proprietary stuff
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:54): since i dont make money and am not a business hehee
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:54): yet wanting to have viewable content on all browsers
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:55): I will read more i read a bit a while ago on <sectin> <aside> elements and the dictionary lists
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:55): cool
a81bb49f6a219ef0cc5aa48e9e3b0fe0 (04:55): im happy <iframe> are still in heheh i like to use iframe and name attribute so people can click a link and have it work in the inline frame
